927.00  DEFINITIONS.
       (a)   "Major Park" means any one of the following named public parks:
      (1)       Morgan Street Reservoir
      (2)       James F. "Bill" Long Nature Preserve
      (3)       Oberlin Roadside Park
      (4)       Parsons Road Reservoir
      (5)       Hamilton Recreation Complex
 
       (b)   "Minor Park" means any one of the following named public parks:
      (1)   Depot Park
      (2)   Martin Luther King, Jr. Memorial Park
      (3)   Wright Memorial Park
      (4)   Legion Field
      (5)   Don J. Pease Memorial Bike Trail
      (6)   Park Street Park (Pleasant Street Park)
      (7)   Spring Street Park
      (8)   East College Street Project Plaza.
      (9)   Underground Railroad Park.
         (Ord. 19-45 AC CMS.  Passed 7-1-19.)
927.01  ADVERTISEMENTS;  SIGNS.
   No person shall post any sign, handbill, pamphlet, circular, notice, emblem
or advertisement upon any structure, tree or thing on the park premises.
(Ord.  19-45 AC CMS.  Passed 7-1-19.)
927.02  ALCOHOL, DRUGS, NARCOTICS, INTOXICANTS AND CONTROLLED  SUBSTANCES.
   No person shall transport, bring within, possess, distribute, sell, give
away, ingest or be under the influence of alcohol, illegal  drugs, narcotics,
intoxicants or other controlled substances at any time in or near any park
proper. Violators will be prosecuted to the fullest extent possible.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS.  Passed 7-1-19.)
927.03  ANIMALS.
   No person shall bring or allow to be loose any animal in the parks, unless
upon a leash not more than eight  feet in length, including retractable
leashes. Pets must be attended and controlled at all times, and are prohibited
in playground areas. Any animal found on park property running at large may be
impounded. Dog training is not permitted. It is unlawful for any person to
bring a dog into a park unless it has been properly licensed. No person shall
permit a pet to dig up or otherwise damage park property, nor to defecate
without said person immediately removing all feces deposited by the animal, and
disposing of same in a sanitary manner. It shall not be unlawful for a seeing-
eye dog to be in any park when accompanied by a sight impaired person. No
person shall attempt to hunt, trap, catch, wound, kill, or treat cruelly any
bird or animal, or molest or rob the nest of any bird or animal located in any
park. No person shall abandon, dispose of or otherwise release any animal or
fish into a park.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.04  CAMPING.
   No person shall place, erect, or use any tent, camper, travel trailer, motor
home, sleeping bag, hammock or other shelter, or otherwise camp or sleep in any
park.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.05  DISORDERLY CONDUCT.
   No person shall make or assist in making any improper noise, riot,
disturbance or breach of the peace in any park, or be guilty of any disorderly
conduct. No person shall collect with other persons, in bodies or crowds, for
unlawful purposes, or for any purpose to the annoyance, obstruction or
disturbance of other persons. No person shall utter any profane, obscene or
abusive language or ethnic slur, nor make any indecent, threatening or obscene
advances or gestures while within a park. No person shall take, or attempt to
take any immoral, improper or indecent liberties with any child or adult of
either sex in any park. No person shall appear in a park in a state of nudity,
or perform or engage in sexual contact or conduct, nor make any indecent
exposure of his or her person, nor solicit to engage in sexual activity for
hire.
   Boisterous, excessively loud, immoral or indecent behavior and fighting are
prohibited. No person shall engage in any activity in a manner so as to
endanger, injure, or damage persons or property in the parks. Climbing trees,
rocks and park structures, (with the exception of playground equipment), is not
permitted, nor is repelling from such.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.06  FIREWORKS.
   No person shall carry, discharge or cause to be exploded any fireworks or
other explosive substances in the parks, except City-sponsored events or
otherwise by written permission of the City Manager.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.07  FIREARMS AND WEAPONS.
   The unlawful possession, use or discharge of any type of a firearm or the
possession of any knife, switchblade, bow and arrow, air gun, paintball gun, B-
B gun, spring-operated gun, slingshot, or other offensive weapon within a City
park or recreation area is strictly forbidden. The throwing of stones or the
launching of other harmful projectiles within a City park or recreation area is
forbidden. The term "firearm" as used in this section shall have the same
meaning as in Ohio R.C. 2923.11.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS.  Passed 7-1-19.)
927.08  FIRES.
   No person shall light or make use of any fire in the parks, except such
portions thereof as may be designated by the City for the cooking of food, such
as in a grill. Every fire, ember or burning briquettes shall be under the
continuous care and direction of a competent person from the time the fire is
kindled until it is completely extinguished. No person shall throw away or
discard any match, cigarette, cigar, ember or briquettes or other burning
object which has not been entirely extinguished before being thrown away or
discarded in receptacles or areas provided. Dumping hot ashes or fire into the
grass is prohibited. No portable stoves or grills shall be permitted in
shelters, park buildings or on combustible picnic tables.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.09  FISHING.
   Fishing in park waters is permitted and is subject to the statutes of the
State of Ohio, except that the use of unattended hooks, traps, gigs, bows and
arrows, fishing between the hours that the park is closed, or in areas posted
by the City as no fishing, is prohibited. Ice fishing is not permitted.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.10  GAMBLING.
   No person shall operate or participate in gambling, play at or abet any game
of chance or use any gambling device in any park for money or other thing of
value.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.11  HINDERING OF EMPLOYEES.
   No person shall interfere with, or in any manner hinder any employee or
agent of the City while engaged in constructing, repairing, patrolling or
caring for any park property.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.12  HOURS OF OPERATION.
   No person shall be permitted to remain, stop or park within the confines of
any major park thirty (30) minutes after sunset and (30) minutes before
sunrise, except in emergency. No person shall leave any vehicle within the
confines of any park once closed. If so, the vehicle shall be subject to a
parking fine and removal at the owner's expense.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS.  Passed 7-1-19.)
927.13  HUNTING AND TRAPPING.
   No person shall within the confines of a park hunt, pursue with animals,
with electric or mechanical devices, trap or in any other way molest any bird
or animal. No person shall use spotlights or headlights of any kind to
illuminate wildlife within the confines of any park, except in cases where the
purpose for doing so is to avoid injury to persons, property or wildlife.
Personnel authorized by the City to do so may trap animals for the purpose of
re-locating them.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.14  LOITERING.
   No person or group of persons shall loiter in or near a motor vehicle or
vehicles within or adjacent to any park. No person or group of persons shall
commit upon any public sidewalk, entrance or exit to any public place in the
park any act or thing which is an obstruction or interference to the free and
lawfully conducted use thereof by anyone.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.15  MINORS.
   The parent or legal guardian of a minor, (defined as a person under the age
of eighteen years), who resides with such parent or legal guardian shall be
liable for any fine or condition of restitution or reparation imposed by a
court upon a minor for violation of this chapter; provided that the minor has
not paid the fine or made restitution or reparation within the time ordered by
the court; and further provided, that said parent or legal guardian has been
served with summons or notice to appear in the original cause and all
proceedings thereafter as provided by law.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.16  NOISE.
   Except as a warning for danger, no person, or animal under a person's
control, shall make an unusually loud or unnecessary noise, or which in any
manner annoys, disturbs, injures or endangers the comfort, repose, health,
peace or safety of others within and immediately adjacent to any park. No
person shall, in or in proximity to a park, play any radio, stereo, boom box,
musical instrument, tape player, etc. at a volume that is annoying to others.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.17  NOXIOUS MATERIAL AND SEWAGE DUMPING.
   No person shall, either within or adjacent to any park, place or permit to
be placed into the air, stream, reservoir, pond, water fountain, ditch or drain
that flows into or through park lands, any noxious material or sewage which may
render park waters or land harmful to public health, or to animal, vegetative
or aquatic life, or which may prevent, limit or interfere with the use of such
waters for domestic or agricultural purposes, or which may lessen to an
unreasonable degree the use and enjoyment of the park.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.18  POWERED MODEL TOYS.
   No person shall operate or permit to be operated any gasoline, battery or
fuel powered miniature model or toy airplane, helicopter, rocket, boat, car or
similar device in any park, without prior authorization from the City Manager.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.19  REFUSE.
   No person shall throw, drop, discard, place or leave any litter, garbage,
debris, rubbish or any other form of refuse in or on any park or waters, except
in receptacles provided for that purpose. No person shall discharge or cause to
be discharged any injurious or vile substance of any kind into the air or upon
any park land or waters. No person shall use any park trash receptacle to
deposit any bulk quantity of household refuse or material of any kind that has
been brought to the park for the purpose of disposing of that material
(violators will be prosecuted). No person shall utilize any picnic shelter,
gazebo, playground or other facility and upon vacating said facility or area,
cause it then to be left in a state of clutter or disarray, unsanitary or
unclean, inclusive but not limited to food scraps, animal droppings, graffiti
or litter.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.20  RESERVATIONS.
   Persons may inquire about making a reservation for a picnic shelter or other
park facility, for a specific date and time, subject to availability and fees,
if any, as determined by the City, by contacting the City Recreation
Department.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.21  SOLICITING AND CONCESSIONEERING.
   No person shall offer or exchange for sale any article, thing, privilege or
service, or do any hawking, peddling, begging or soliciting, or buy or offer to
buy any article, thing, privilege or service; nor shall any person take up any
collection, invite subscriptions, solicit or receive contributions of money or
anything of value for gift or donation in any park, without written permission
from the City Manager. No concession operations shall be allowed to vend or
offer for sale any goods, foods, wares, merchandise, produce or supplies in any
park without prior written authorization from the City Manager.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.22  TRAFFIC AND PARKING.
   No person shall operate automobiles, trucks, motorbikes, all terrain
vehicles, go-carts, snowmobiles or other motor-driven vehicles, except for
authorized park vehicles or emergency vehicles, within any park. The only
exception shall be Westwood Cemetery, where licensed automobiles and
motorcycles are permitted on designated park roads. No person shall park any
vehicle in any park except in such places and in such a manner as designated by
the City. No person shall park any vehicle in any parking area of a park
between dusk and dawn, unless otherwise posted. No person shall perform in any
park or its parking areas any non-emergency maintenance and repairs on any
vehicle, nor leave debris from such action in any of the parks. Campers and
travel trailers may not be parked in vehicular parking spaces. Vehicles may not
be backed into a pull-in parking space, but rather must park in a head-in
fashion. The City is not responsible for preventing theft or damage in relation
to private vehicles while parked at any City park.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.23  TRESPASSING.
   Whoever enters upon any major park, as defined in this chapter, between
thirty (30) minutes after sunset and thirty (30) minutes before sunrise, unless
otherwise posted or in an emergency, shall be guilty of trespass. Whoever
loiters in any minor park, as defined in this chapter, thirty (30) minutes
after sunset and thirty (30) before sunrise, shall be guilty of trespass.
Entrance into any minor park thirty (30) minutes after sunset and thirty (30)
minutes before sunrise shall be for the sole purpose of passing through to a
public place outside of that park. Any violation of such hours shall be subject
to criminal prosecution. No person shall at any time trespass from park
property onto private property.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS.  Passed 7-1-19.)
927.24  VANDALISM.
   No person shall injure, deface, write upon, destroy, disturb, or remove any
part of a park or structure therein, be it naturally occurring or man-made,
including but not limited to any tree, shrub, flower, plant, turf, stone
surface, or any of the buildings, fences, bridges, lamps, posts, signs, public
notices, monuments, benches, water fountains, playground equipment, road,
trail, or any part thereof in any park.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.25  WATERS, USE OF.
   No person shall swim, wade or bathe in any of the reservoirs, ponds or
creeks in any park. No person shall operate any type of water vehicle,
including aquatic boats, ice boats, sail boards, and Jet-Skis, nor make use of
scuba diving or flotation equipment in park waters, unless authorized in
writing by the City Manager, or in an emergency by City-authorized personnel.
The lone exception for boating is the Parson's Road reservoir, where this is
permitted subject to the City's agreement with the State of Ohio, and to other
restrictions that the City may set. Ice fishing and ice skating is not
permitted. No person or company shall be allowed to pump water from any park
property, unless granted written permission from the City Manager.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.26  ENFORCEMENT; PENALTY.
   City police officers are authorized to patrol City parks and to issue
citations to persons for violations of this chapter and other applicable laws.
City auxiliary police officers may assist with park rule enforcement to the
extent of their authority as established by the City. Any person who has
violated a park rule or other applicable law may be ejected from any and all
park properties for the remainder of the day on which the violation occurred.
Ejection from park property may be instituted in conjunction with written
warnings or citations. No person shall resist, fail or refuse to obey, or in
any way interfere with, hinder, or prevent any officer in the discharge of
their duty. Each and every violation of the provisions of this chapter shall
constitute a separate offense. Any person who shall violate any provision of
this chapter shall be guilty of a minor misdemeanor for each offense upon
conviction thereof. Nothing contained in this chapter shall prevent violators
from being charged or penalized under other provisions of the Ohio Revised
Code, municipal ordinances or other applicable laws, rules or regulations. 
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.27  PARK RULES AND REGULATIONS.
   Copies of park rules and regulations shall be on file in the offices of the
City Recreation Department, Clerk of Council and the Police Department. These
rules and regulations shall be published in booklet form and made available to
the public upon request. It shall be the responsibility of any individual
entering a City park to be aware of and obey all park rules and regulations.
Failure to comply with park rules, posted or not, may result in the issuance of
a citation(s), expulsion from park grounds, or arrest. The City reserves the
right to sponsor special events or to grant written permission to individuals
or organizations for special events, which may result in some temporary
exceptions or waivers of certain park rules, as permitted and specified by the
City at the City's discretion.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.28  LIABILITY.
   The City of Oberlin is not liable for injuries, lost possessions or property
damage which may occur to visitors while on park premises. Use of City parks is
at a visitor's own risk.
(Ord. 19-45 AC CMS. Passed 7-1-19.)
927.29  SMOKING AND TOBACCO.
   (a)   Smoking, as defined in Chapter
506, of the Codified Ordinances, and the use of smokeless tobacco products is
hereby prohibited in any areas of any Oberlin Park, as defined in Section
927.00, as may be established by the City Manager as non-smoking and tobacco-
free zones.
      (1)   No person found to be smoking or using smokeless tobacco products
in such designated non-smoking and tobacco-free zones in a park shall fail to
immediately cease said activity when requested to do so by City staff, a Police
Officer, or a person charged with the management, operation or care of any
City-owned park, including any baseball or softball umpire or soccer official.
      (2)   Should a person found to be smoking or using smokeless tobacco
products in a non-smoking and tobacco free zone in a park not immediately cease
said activity when requested to do so, as described in subsection (a)(1)
hereof, he or she  shall be guilty of a minor misdemeanor.
      (3)   Persons who repeatedly violate this section, may be permanently
banned from City Parks.
      (4)   Lack of intent to violate a provision of this chapter shall not be
a defense to a violation. 
   (b)   At least one sign informing the public of the ban shall be placed at
the entrance of each such non-smoking and tobacco-free zone established by the
City Manager. Notice shall also be placed at such location(s) within each park
designated for notices and information, and shall be included in appropriate
forms, documents and other materials provided to residents and others when
reserving park facilities or space.  (Ord. 19-45 AC CMS.  Passed 7-1-19.)

1101.01  RESIDENTIAL CODE OF OHIO FOR ONE, TWO AND THREE FAMILY DWELLINGS
ADOPTED.
   Under the provisions of Ohio R.C. 731.231 there is hereby adopted by the
City of Oberlin, and incorporated as if fully set out herein, for the purpose
of regulating the erection, construction, repair, alteration and maintenance of
residential buildings, that certain code known as the Residential Code of Ohio
for One, Two and Three-Family Dwellings, 2017 Edition, promulgated by the Ohio
Board of Building Standards pursuant to Ohio R.C. 3781.10.
(Ord. 18-46 AC CMS.  Passed 6-18-18.)
1101.02   FILE AND SALE COPIES.
   A complete copy of the Residential Code of Ohio for One, Two and Three-
Family Dwellings, as adopted herein is on file with the Council Clerk and Chief
Building Official for inspection by the public and also on file in the Lorain
County Law Library. The Council Clerk has copies available for distribution to
the public at cost.
(Ord. 18-46 AC CMS.  Passed 6-18-18.)
CHAPTER 1103
Residential Insulation Requirements
1103.01   Definition.
1103.02   Minimum R value.
1103.03   Material and thickness.
1103.04   Identification; inspection.
 
1103.01  DEFINITION.
   As used in this chapter "R" value applies to insulating material and is the
rating of a material's ability to resist heat flow. Mathematically it is the
reciprocal of the coefficient of thermal transmission "U". Thus: "R" = 1/"U".
Therefore, the greater the "R" number, the better the insulating value.
(Ord. 1182AC. Passed 3-15-76.)
1103.02  MINIMUM R VALUE.
   Every new residential structure or any addition to a residential structure
shall have properly installed thermal insulation of a minimum "R" value as
follows:
 
a.  Ceilings                                                                     R-
                                                                                  19
b.  Walls                                                                         
    (1)  Exterior frame walls                                                  R-
                                                                                  11
    (2)    Wall between habitable space and unheated garage or other unheated R-
areas                                                                             11
    (3)    Exterior masonry walls of habitable areas                          R-
                                                                                  4
    (4)    Crawl space (when unheated)                                        R-
                                                                                  4
(c)  Floors over unheated areas                                                  R-
                                                                                  11
(i.e., basements, crawl spaces, garages and breezeways)                            
      (1)   A basement shall be considered unheated unless it is provided with
a positive heat supply equivalent to at least 15% of the total calculated heat
loss of the living unit or contains the heating unit and uninsulated ducts or
piping.
      (2)   A crawl space shall be considered unheated unless it is provided
with a positive heat supply equivalent to at least 10% of the total calculated
heat loss of the living unit or contains the heating unit and uninsulated ducts
or piping.
      (3)   A garage shall be considered unheated unless it is provided with a
positive heat supply to maintain a minimum temperature of 50° F.
   (d)   Concrete slabs on grade or on fill above grade R-7.  The total width
or depth of insulation, along the perimeter shall be 24 inches and of a rigid
water repellent type material or equivalent.
   (e)   Windows in heated areas shall be double glaze or single glaze with
storm windows.
   (f)   The design temperature for habitable spaces shall be a minimum of 70°
F., with an outside temperature of minus 10° F.
      (Ord. 1182 AC. Passed 3-15-76.)
1103.03  MATERIAL AND THICKNESS.
   The required degree of insulation ("R" value) shall be achieved by:
 
R-4  3/4"   Styrofoam or its equivalent
R-7  2"   Styrofoam or its equivalent
R-11 3-1/2"    Fiberglass or its equivalent
R-18 2"    Urethane or its equivalent
R-19 6"    Fiberglass or its equivalent
 
(Ord. 1182AC. Passed 3-15-76.)
               
1103.04  IDENTIFICATION; INSPECTION.
   All insulation shall be identified, inspected and approved as follows:
   (a)   Identification. Containers of fill type insulation shall have the name
of the manufacturer and trade name of the insulation. The installer shall affix
one of these labels on the building adjacent to the installation, together with
the specified thickness of insulation, "R" value, and manufacturer's
recommended installation density. All other types of insulation shall be
labeled with the name of the manufacturer, trade name or product, specified
thickness and "R" value (a reflective surface may omit the specified
thickness). The required labeling shall occur with sufficient frequency to be
readily observable.
   (b)   Inspections and Approval. Insulation shall be inspected and approved
by the Building Department prior to covering or concealment. It shall be the
duty of the person to whom the building permit was issued to provide
certification and data sufficient to assure that the insulating material
complies with the foregoing requirements and to give notice to the Building
Official when the installation is ready for inspection.
Exception. Retro fitting type materials (i.e., blown or foamed) may be
inspected according to accepted industry practice.
      (Ord. 1182AC.  Passed 3-15-76.)
CHAPTER 1105
Fire Limits
   EDITOR'S NOTE: Former Chapter
1105 has been deleted from the Codified Ordinances since the Ohio Basic
Building Code now contains sufficient standards for construction within that
area previously designated as fire limits.

1111.02  REFUNDS FOR PERMIT REVOCATION PROHIBITED; COMMENCEMENT AND COMPLETION
OF WORK.
   There shall be no refunds of any fee in the event a permit is cancelled or
revoked. Work authorized by any permit issued under this chapter shall be
commenced within six months from the date of issuance of such permit or such
permit shall be void. Such work, when once commenced, shall be completed
without unnecessary delay.
(Ord. 70AC CMS. Passed 5-19-58.)
1111.03  PLUMBING PERMIT FEES.
   The fee for a plumbing permit shall be paid, based on the following
computations:
   (a)   New installations or additions to existing system in such amount as
provided by ordinance. If wiring is required a separate electrical permit is to
be obtained.
   (b)   Repair or replacement of fixtures, soil, or waste line and hot water
heaters, in such amount as provided by ordinance.
      (Ord. 1733AC CMS. Passed 12-5-83.)
   (c)   Fixtures moved more than four feet from their original location shall
be classified as installation of new fixtures.
   (d)   Permit for sewer tap and street opening, as provided in Part Nine -
Streets, Utilities and Public Services Code, Chapter
903 and Section
915.06.
1111.04  ELECTRICAL PERMIT FEES.
   Electrical permit fees for the following classifications are established by
separate ordinance.
   (a)   New installations.
   (b)   Additions to existing system.
   (c)   Service charge from existing system three-wire and from existing
system four-wire.
   (d)   For each reinspection made necessary by incompetent, incomplete or
negligent work, there shall be a penalty fee payable by the individual issued
the original permit.
      (Ord. 1047AC CMS. Passed 6-17-74.)
1111.05  POWER PERMIT FEES.
   Power permit fees for the following classifications are established by
separate ordinance:
   (a)   For each electrical appliance installed and shall include but is not
limited to the following: air conditioners, motors up to 10 HP, electric
heaters, hot water heaters, clothes dryers, ranges and meter openings.
   (b)   Temporary service for construction.
   (c)   Temporary service pending final.
      (Ord. 1047AC CMS. Passed 6-17-74.)

1113.01  PERMIT REQUIRED PRIOR TO COMMENCEMENT OF WORK.
   All permits and certificates required under the provisions of the Codified
Ordinances, or any supplemental ordinances thereto, for the construction,
remodeling, demolishing or razing of a building or structure shall be secured
prior to commencement of such work.
(Ord. 329AC CMS. Passed 11-18-63.)
1113.02  OWNER TO OBTAIN, CONTRACTOR TO INSPECT PERMIT.
   The owner of the property upon which such construction, razing or demolition
is to be accomplished shall be responsible for securing the necessary permits
or certificates, and no contractor or agent of the owner shall commence any
construction, remodeling or razing without inspecting the permit or certificate
for such work.
(Ord. 329AC CMS. Passed 11-18-63.)
1113.99  PENALTY.
   Any person, firm or corporation who commences the construction, remodeling
or razing of a structure or building prior to the issuance of a permit or
certificate, or who fails to secure a permit or certificate as required under
the ordinances of the City, shall be fined not more than one hundred dollars
($100.00).
CHAPTER 1115
Contractor Registration
1115.01   Registration required.
1115.02   Definitions.
1115.03   Registration application and renewal.
1115.04   Fee for registration.
1115.05   Waiver.
1115.06   Suspension of registration.
1115.07   Appeal of suspension.
1115.08   Persons exempt from registration.
1115.99   Penalty.
 
1115.01  REGISTRATION REQUIRED.
   All persons, firms, corporations, partnerships or any combination thereof,
engaged as a contractor as hereinafter defined, shall be required to register
for all trades engaged within the City before performing any work within the
City and shall be subject to all the provisions of this chapter.
(Ord. 1078AC. Passed 1-20-75.)
1115.02  DEFINITIONS.
   (a)   "Contractor" means a person, firm, corporation, partnership or any
combination thereof, who engages for hire in construction or improvements
within the City in one or more trade categories, whether acting for themselves
or others, and whether such trade is being performed by themselves, their
employees or under subcontract. In the event that the one trade category is
under subcontract, no work shall be performed until the subcontractor is
registered by the City.
   (b)   "Trade" means field of work requiring special skill or involving the
use of specialized building crafts, and includes the following:
      (1)   Masonry, which includes, but is not limited to, brick laying, block
laying, concrete and cement, asphalt work and paving.
      (2)   Carpentry, which includes, but is not limited to, woodworking,
siding, roofing and windows.
      (3)   Heating, tinning, central air conditioning and sheet metal work.
      (4)   Wall covering, which includes, but is not limited to plastering,
dry wall, taping, insulating and lath work.
      (5)   Excavation, which includes, but is not limited to, sanitary sewer
work, storm sewer work and general excavating, earth moving and grading.
      (6)   Structural iron work for new construction.
      (7)   Sign erection.
      (8)   Swimming pool installation for all pools installed below grade.
         (Ord. 1078AC. Passed 1-20-75.)
1115.03  REGISTRATION APPLICATION AND RENEWAL.
   (a)   Application. Application for registration shall be made to the Chief
Building Official or Residential Building Official on forms provided therefore.
 
   (b)   Qualifications for Registration.
      (1)   The applicant for trades (1) through (6) and (8) specified in
Section
1115.02(b) shall have a minimum of two years practical experience; an affidavit
to this effect shall be provided. In lieu of the experience required, the
applicant may qualify with two years technical training in an accredited
school; proof of the same shall be furnished at time of registration.
      (2)   The applicant shall provide any and all references as may be
requested on the application form in the manner provided.
      (3)   All registrations shall expire on December 31 of the year in which
they are in force. Renewal of registration may be commenced thirty days prior
to the expiration date. For renewal of registration, the final date will be
January 31 within the year that the registration is to be renewed.
      (4)   Every applicant for registration shall, upon the approval of this
application, furnish and file with the Building Division, proof of public
liability insurance in a minimum sum of one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000)
and property damage insurance in a minimum sum of fifty thousand dollars
($50,000).
         (Ord. 11-22 AC CMS.  Passed 4-18-11.)
1115.04  FEE FOR REGISTRATION.
   EDITOR’S NOTE: See Section
1111.01.
1115.05  WAIVER.
   The Chief Building Official or Residential Building Official, with the
concurrence of the City Manager, may waive any or all of the above requirements
in cases of hardship.
(Ord. 11-22 AC CMS.  Passed 4-18-11.)
1115.06  SUSPENSION OF REGISTRATION.
   Registration may be suspended by the Chief Building Official or Residential
Building Official upon giving written notice to that effect to the contractor
for the following reasons:
   (a)   Violation of any provision of this chapter and any law of the Building
Code;
   (b)   Misrepresentation of material fact in order to become registered, or
in the renewal of registration;
   (c)   Failure to secure permits, inspections and approvals required by the
Building Code and regulations of the Building Department;
   (d)   Use of registration to obtain a permit for another;
   (e)   Failure or refusal to correct a violation of the Building Code within
a prescribed period of time or to correct incompetent work as ordered by the
Chief Building Official or Residential Building Official; or
   (f)   For any other reason that is determined to be adverse to the health,
safety and welfare of the citizens of the City.
      (Ord. 11-22 AC CMS.  Passed 4-18-11.)
1115.07  APPEAL OF SUSPENSION.
   (a)   The Housing Renewal Commission shall hear all appeals of a decision to
suspend registration by the Chief Building Official or Residential Building
Official.
   (b)   Persons, firms or corporations aggrieved by the decision of the Chief
Building Official or Residential Building Official, may within five working
days of the date of receipt of notice of suspension appeal to the Housing
Renewal Commission by filing with the Chief Building Official or Residential
Building Official written notice of appeal, specifying the reasons therefor.
   (c)   The Housing Renewal Commission, within three working days of the date
of receipt of the appeal by the Chief Building Official or Residential Building
Official shall afford a public meeting upon such appeal. The Commission shall
at that meeting affirm or reverse the decision of the Chief Building Official
or Residential Building Official.
   (d)   The Commission shall affirm the decision of the Chief Building
Official or Residential Building Official unless it finds:
      (1)   That the Chief Building Official or Residential Building Official
erred as a matter of law; or
      (2)   That the decision is not supported by reliable or probative
evidence.
   (e)   Three members of the Commission shall constitute a quorum. In the
event there is no quorum, the public meeting may be continued one time for no
longer than three working days. The affirmative votes of three members shall be
required to reverse a decision of the Chief Building Official or Residential
Building Official. No member of the Commission shall pass on any question in
which he/her has a financial or personal interest.
   (f)   Any party aggrieved by the decision of the Housing Renewal Commission
may appeal to Council for final judgment by filing written notice thereof to
the Clerk of City Council within thirty days of the date of the decision by the
Housing Renewal Commission. Council shall make a decision within thirty days.
   (g)   No person shall do any work authorized by a certificate of
registration when the same is suspended or revoked. (Ord. 11-22 AC CMS.  Passed
4-18-11.)
1115.08  PERSONS EXEMPT FROM REGISTRATION.
   (a)    Home Owners. No provision or provisions of this chapter shall be
construed to require that a bona fide owner of a one, two or three-family
dwelling to be registered, who personally will perform work upon his/her
premises. Home owners, however, shall be required to obtain all necessary
permits. Such work shall be performed in accordance with the Building Code and
according to plans and specifications filed with the application for permit.
 
   (b)    Government Agencies; Public Utilities; Private Organizations.
Provisions of registration shall not apply to federal, State, county or
municipal governmental agencies or public utilities furnishing services to the
City under municipal-utilities franchise agreement, to industrial, commercial
or institutional organizations. A maintenance department, doing work within the
provisions of the Building Code, is provided for except that should work
covered by the Building Code be contracted to outside concerns, then such
contractors shall be registered with the City as provided therein.
 
   (c)    Public Contractors.  Provisions of registration shall not apply to
contractors engaged in the repair, replacement or construction of sidewalks,
streets and curbs, water mains, sanitary sewers, storm sewers and/or related
excavation work when such work is performed under a contract with the City.
(Ord. 11-25 AC CMS.  Passed 5-2-11.)
1115.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be fined not more than
one hundred dollars ($100.00). Each day such violation continues shall
constitute a separate offense.

1121.01   CODE ADOPTED.
   Under the provisions of Ohio R.C. 731.231 there is hereby adopted by the
City of Oberlin, and incorporated as if fully set out herein, for the purpose
of prescribing requirements governing the inspection, design, construction,
installation, alteration, repair, addition or replacement to drainage, plumbing
and water-supply systems, that certain code known as the Ohio Plumbing Code
2017 Edition promulgated by the Ohio Board of Building Standards pursuant to
Ohio R.C. 3781.10.  (Ord. 18-46 AC CMS.  Passed 6-18-18.)
1121.02  FILE AND DISTRIBUTION COPIES.
   A complete copy of the Ohio State Plumbing Code as adopted herein is  on 
file  with  the  Council Clerk and Chief Building Official for inspection by
the public and also on file in the  Lorain  County Law Library. The Council
Clerk has copies available for distribution to the public at cost.  (Ord. 18-46
AC CMS.  Passed 6-18-18.)

Definitions

1123.21   Dead end.
1123.22   Stack.
 
CROSS REFERENCE
   Ohio Building Code definitions - see Ohio Building Code BB-1
 
1123.01  APPLICATION OF DEFINITIONS.
   For the purpose of this Plumbing Code, the following words or terms shall be
deemed and construed to have the meanings and definitions given therefor in
this chapter.
(1957 Code §1123.01)
1123.02  APPRENTICE PLUMBER.
   "Apprentice plumber" means a person who is registered as such and who is
undergoing an apprenticeship or course of training, not exceeding five years,
for the purpose of learning the trade of plumbing. An apprentice, as herein
defined, shall perform no work regulated by this Plumbing Code, or amendments
hereto, except as an assistant, under the direct supervision of a master
plumber, and in the immediate presence of a licensed master plumber or a
licensed journeyman plumber.
(1957 Code §1123.02)
1123.03  JOURNEYMAN PLUMBER.
   "Journeyman plumber" means a person who supervises, installs, alters or
repairs plumbing systems, or parts thereof, as an employee, but does not
furnish material or supplies, and who is registered and the legal possessor of
a journeyman plumber's license, as provided for in this Plumbing Code.
(1957 Code §1123.03)
1123.04  MASTER PLUMBER.
   "Master plumber" means a person duly certified and licensed as such and
authorized to engage in the installation of plumbing, through contract or
otherwise, and also in planning engineering. superintending installation,
maintenance and repair with respect to plumbing in all of its branches, and as
such, a master plumber is authorized to employ journeymen plumbers and
plumber's apprentices and other persons necessary for the proper installation
of plumbing work in accordance with the plumbing regulations and provisions of
this Plumbing Code.
(1957 Code §1123.04)
1123.05  PLUMBING.
   "Plumbing" means the art of installing in buildings the pipes, fixtures and
other apparatus for bringing in a safe water supply and removing liquid and
water-carried wastes.
(1957 Code §1123.05)
1123.06  PLUMBING SYSTEM; DRAINAGE SYSTEM.
   The "plumbing system" of a building means and includes the water supply
distributing pipes; fixture traps; soil, waste and vent pipes; building drain
and building sewer, and storm water drainage, with their devices, appurtenances
and connections, all within or adjacent to the building.  The "drainage system"
means that part of the plumbing system exclusive of the water supply and
distributing pipes.
(1957 Code §1123.06)
1123.07  WATER SERVICE PIPE.
   "Water service pipe" means the pipe from the water main to the building
served.
(1957 Code §1123.07)
1123.08  WATER DISTRIBUTION PIPES.
   "Water distribution pipes" means those pipes which convey the water from the
service pipe to the plumbing fixtures.
(1957 Code §1123.08)
1123.09  PLUMBING FIXTURES.
   "Plumbing fixtures" means receptacles intended to receive and discharge
water, liquid or water-carried wastes into the drainage system with which they
are connected.
(1957 Code §1123.09)
1123.10  TRAP.
   "Trap" means a fitting or device so constructed as to prevent the passage of
air or gas through a pipe without materially affecting the flow of sewage or
waste water through it.   
(1957 Code §1123.10)
1123.11  TRAP SEAL.
   "Trap seal" means the vertical distance between the crown weir and the dip
of the trap. (1957 Code §1123.11)
1123.12  VENT PIPE.
   "Vent pipe" means any pipe provided to ventilate a building drainage system
and to prevent trap siphonage and back pressure.  (1957 Code §1123.12)
1123.13  LOCAL VENTILATING PIPE.
   "Local ventilating pipe" means a pipe through which foul air is removed from
a room or fixture.  (1957 Code §1123.13)
1123.14  SOIL PIPE.
   "Soil pipe" means any pipe which conveys the discharge of water closets,
with or without the discharges from other fixtures, to the building drain.
(1957 Code §1123.14)
1123.15  WASTE PIPE; SPECIAL WASTE.
   "Waste pipe" means any pipe which receives the discharge of any fixture,
except water closets, and conveys the discharge to the building drain, soil or
waste stacks. When the pipe does not connect directly with a building drain or
soil stack, it is termed a special waste.
(1957 Code §1123.15)
1123.16  MAIN.
   "Main" of any system of horizontal, vertical or continuous piping means that
part of the system which receives the wastes, vent or back vents from fixtures,
outlets or traps, direct or through branch pipes.
(1957 Code §1123.16)
1123.17  BRANCH.
   "Branch" of any system of piping means that part of the system which extends
horizontally at a slight grade, with or without lateral or vertical extensions
or vertical arms, from the main to receive fixture outlets not directly
connected to the main.
(1957 Code §1123.17)
1123.18  BUILDING DRAIN.
   "Building drain" means that part of the lowest horizontal piping of a
building drainage system which receives the discharge from the soil, waste and
other drainage pipes inside the walls of any building and conveys the discharge
to the building sewer beginning five feet outside the inner face of the
building wall.
(1957 Code §1123.18)
1123.19  BUILDING SEWER.
   "Building sewer" means that part of the horizontal piping of a building
drainage system extending from the building drain five feet outside the inner
face of the building wall to its connection with the main sewer or cesspool and
conveying the drainage of but one building site.
(1957 Code §1123.19)
1123.20  SIZE AND LENGTH.
   The given "caliber" or "size of pipe" means the caliber or size for a
nominal internal diameter, other than iron pipe size. The "developed length" of
a pipe means its length along the center line of the pipe and fittings.
(1957 Code §1123.20)
1123.21  DEAD END.
   "Dead end" means a branch leading from a soil, waste or vent pipe, building
drain or building sewer which is terminated at a developed distance of two feet
or more, by means of a cap, plug or other fitting not used for admitting water
to the pipe.
(1957 Code §1123.21)
1123.22  STACK.
   "Stack" means any vertical line of soil, waste or vent piping.
(1957 Code §1123.22)

1121.03
 
1127.01  LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No person shall engage in the business of plumbing, or do work at the trade
of plumbing in the City, until he/she shall have first procured a license
therefor in accordance with the provisions of this Plumbing Code. 
(1957 Code §1127.01)
1127.02  TYPES OF LICENSES.
   (a)   Type 1 - Journeyman Plumber's License.  A journeyman plumber's license
shall authorize the licensee to engage in, work at or supervise the trade or
occupation of plumbing in the City, but shall not authorize the licensee to
engage in the business of installing plumbing.
   (b)   Type 2 - Master Plumber's License.  A master plumber's license shall
authorize the licensee to engage in the business of installing of plumbing in
buildings or other structures or on premises by or under the supervision of the
licensee, for public hire or otherwise within the City.  (1957 Code §1127.02)
1127.03  LICENSE APPLICATION.
   Every application for a plumber's license of any type shall be in writing
and on such form as the Housing Renewal Commission prescribes, and shall set
forth the name, citizenship, residence, place of business or occupation of the
applicant, and length of time he/she has been engaged in the business or trade
of plumbing, together with a stipulation that, if granted a license, he/she
will comply with all laws, ordinances, resolutions and public regulations of
competent authority relating to plumbing, sanitation and allied work.
(1957 Code §1127.03; Ord. 94-67AC.  Passed 9-19-94.)
1127.04  REPORTING VIOLATIONS.
   It shall be the duty of the City Manager, or his/her agent, or any other
person to report all violations of the provisions of this Plumbing Code to the
Housing Renewal Commission and to assemble and present to the Commission all
known available information, the date of and the material reflecting upon the
violation.
(1957 Code §1127.04; Ord. 94-67AC.  Passed 9-19-94.)
1127.05  LICENSE RE-APPLICATION AFTER REVOCATION.
   No application of a licensee whose license shall have been revoked by the
Housing Renewal Commission shall be entertained until after the expiration of
six months following the revocation.
(1957 Code §1127.05; Ord. 94-67AC.  Passed 9-19-94.)
1127.06  EXAMINATION FEES; APPRENTICE REGISTRATION.
   Every applicant for examination as a master plumber shall pay to the City an
examination fee in such amount as provided by ordinance before taking the
master plumber's examination.  Every journeyman plumber shall pay to the City
an examination fee in such amount as provided by ordinance before taking the
journeyman plumber's examination.  All apprentices shall be registered by the
City and approved by the Housing Renewal Commission.  A registration fee in
such amount as provided by ordinance shall be paid to the City.  All applicants
approved by the Commission shall receive a registration card, letter or badge. 
All apprentice applicants rejected shall be entitled to a refund.  If the
Commission has reason to believe that any master plumber is trying to evade the
licensing law by the registration of too many apprentices in comparison with
the number of qualified licensed plumbers employed by the master plumber, the
Commission shall reject all additional applicants for registration as an
apprentice.
(1957 Code §1127.06; Ord. 1733AC.  Passed 12-5-83; Ord. 94-67AC.  Passed 9-19-
94.)
1127.07  EXAMINATION CERTIFICATE; LICENSE ISSUANCE AND FEE PAYMENT PROCEDURE.
   If, after paying the examination fee and taking the examination, the Housing
Renewal Commission is satisfied of the competency of the applicant, the
Commission shall issue a certificate to him/her directed to the City, which
certificate shall recite that the applicant has passed the examination of a
master plumber or journeyman plumber, as the case may be.  The City, upon
receipt of the certificate, shall, upon the payment of the fee hereinafter
prescribed into the General Fund, issue to the applicant a license in
accordance with the certificate, authorizing him/her to follow and engage in
the occupation or trade of a plumber in the City and in the capacity specified
in the license.
(1957 Code §1127.07; Ord. 94-67AC.  Passed 9-19-94.)
1127.08  MASTER PLUMBER'S LICENSE FEE, BOND, EXPIRATION AND RENEWAL.
   The City shall issue a master plumber's license upon the payment of a fee in
such amount as provided by ordinance and upon the execution by the applicant
for the license of a bond in the sum of one thousand dollars ($1,000) with
sureties thereon to the approval of the City.  Such surety shall preferably be
some approved general surety or bonding company.  The bond shall be conditioned
to save the City and its inhabitants harmless from all liability, loss or
damage of whatsoever nature that may result directly or indirectly to person or
property by reason of any act or neglect of any licensee, or of any person in
his/her employ or working under his/her supervision, with respect to any work
contemplated by the terms of his/her license, and that the licensee will abide
by the laws, ordinances, rules and regulations governing plumbing work in the
City then in force or thereafter established by proper authority.  All master
plumbers' licenses shall expire on December 31 in each year and may be renewed
annually upon the payment of a fee in such amount as provided by ordinance.
(1957 Code §1127.08; Ord. 1733AC.  Passed 12-5-83.)
1127.09  JOURNEYMAN PLUMBER'S LICENSE FEE, EXPIRATION AND RENEWAL.
   The City shall issue a journeyman plumber's license upon the payment of a
fee in such amount as provided by ordinance which shall authorize any work
contemplated by the terms of his/her license.  The licensee shall abide by the
laws, ordinances, rules and regulations governing plumbing work in the City
then in force or thereafter established by proper authority.  All journeyman
plumbers' licenses shall expire on December 31 in each year and may be renewed
annually upon the payment of a fee in such amount as provided by ordinance.
(1957 Code §1127.09)
1127.10  APPRENTICE REGISTRATION EXPIRATION AND RENEWAL.
   Registration cards expire on December 31 in each year and may be renewed
annually upon the payment of a fee in such amount as provided by ordinance.
(1957 Code §1127.10; Ord. 1733AC.  Passed 12-5-83.)
1127.11  FAILURE TO RENEW LICENSE.
   Any person engaged in the occupation of a master plumber or journeyman
plumber who shall fail to secure a renewal of his/her license within thirty
days from the date of the expiration thereof, shall, before he/she shall
receive another license and be eligible to engage in the occupation of
plumbing, present himself/herself to the Housing Renewal Commission and take
the examination, pay the fee and secure the certificate provided for and
prescribed in this Plumbing Code.  No reduction in fees shall be made for any
part of the year having elapsed.
(1957 Code §1127.11; Ord. 94-67AC.  Passed 9-19-94.)
1127.12  APPLICATION FILES REQUIRED.
   All applications approved by the Examining Board shall be forthwith filed
with the City, and all applications rejected shall be so filed together with a
written statement disclosing the reasons for the rejection.  Every person who
shall receive a license, card or badge, either as a master plumber, journeyman
plumber or apprentice, shall register with the secretary of the Housing Renewal
Commission, upon such form or forms as the Commission may prescribe, his/her
name, place of business, home address, length of time engaged in the occupation
of plumbing and where he/she served his/her apprenticeship.
(1957 Code §1127.12; Ord. 94-67AC.  Passed 9-19-94.)
1127.13  PARTNERSHIPS AND CORPORATIONS.
   Every partnership or corporation desiring to engage in the business of
plumbing as a master plumber shall file with the secretary of the Housing
Renewal Commission, a statement subscribed and sworn to by a member of the
partnership or the officers of the corporation and stating its place of
business. Every partnership or corporation shall have at least one member of
the partnership or one officer of the corporation who is a qualified licensed
master plumber, and the partnership or corporation may follow and engage in
business as a master plumber, but when the sole licensed member of the
partnership or corporation ceases to represent it actively, then it shall be
unlawful for the partnership or corporation, or member or employee thereof, to
engage in the business of master plumber until another person has qualified as
herein provided. In the event more than one member of the firm or corporation
shall engage in actual plumbing, the members shall be licensed as follows: one
member of the firm or officer of the corporation shall have a master plumber's
license and all other members who engage in actual plumbing shall have a
journeyman plumber's license or master plumber's license.
(1957 Code §1127.13; Ord. 94-67AC.  Passed 9-19-94.)
1127.14  MASTER PLUMBER'S LICENSE DISPLAY.
   Every licensed master plumber, except a maintenance man as provided for in
Section
1127.20, shall display his/her master plumber's license.
(1957 Code §1127.14)
1127.15  FALSE ADVERTISING AS PLUMBER.
   No person in the City shall advertise or hold himself out to the public as a
plumber, or as a licensed plumber, when such person does not have a license as
provided for in this Plumbing Code.
   No person not in legal possession of a valid master plumber's license issued
by the City shall engage in or represent himself as a master plumber in the
City, or expose or use a sign with the words "master plumber" or "plumber"
thereon, or advertise with similar words for the purpose of implying that he/
she is a master plumber or a plumber.
(1957 Code §1127.15)
1127.16  MASTER PLUMBER: FALSE USE OF NAME; HIRING PRACTICES.
   No licensed master plumber shall allow his/her name to be used by any other
person, directly or indirectly, either to obtain a plumbing permit or to do any
plumbing work under his/her license, except a licensed journeyman plumber in
his/her employ.
   No master plumber shall employ any person to perform the plumbing work of a
journeyman plumber who is not properly licensed as a journeyman plumber.
(1957 Code §1127.16)
1127.17  EMPLOYING UNLICENSED PLUMBERS.
   No person shall permit any unlicensed plumber to do any plumbing work upon
any premises owned by him/her or under his/her control, except as provided and
prescribed in this Plumbing Code. (1957 Code §1127.17)
1127.18  LICENSE RECORDS.
   A record of all plumbers and maintenance licenses shall be kept on file in
the office of the City. (1957 Code §1127.18)
1127.19  DISPOSITION OF FEES COLLECTED.
   All fees collected for licenses and registrations shall be handled in the
same manner as all other fees authorized to be collected by the City.
(1957 Code §1127.19)
1127.20  EXCEPTIONS; MAINTENANCE LICENSES AND REPAIR PERMITS.
   The provisions of this Plumbing Code relative to examinations and licenses
shall not apply to public utilities; public institutions; schools; public
buildings; mercantile, commercial or industrial plants, or other persons, firms
or corporations which maintain departments for the maintenance and repair of
plumbing in or on their respective premises or plants, under expert supervision
in conformity with the laws of the State, and the provisions prescribed in this
Plumbing Code relative to sanitation and plumbing, if the person under whose
expert supervision the maintenance and repair work has been repaired or is
maintained shall first have made an application for a maintenance license and
included a fee in such amount as provided by ordinance.
   The application shall be made in writing upon application blank forms
presented by the City for such purposes and shall contain the name, residence,
address and place of business of the applicant, the length of time he/she has
worked at plumbing work or has been engaged in the business of plumbing, and an
agreement to abide by the laws, ordinances, rules and regulations governing
plumbing work in the City then in force or thereafter established by the proper
authority. The maintenance license shall expire on December 31 of each year and
shall be renewed annually upon the payment of the sum of fifty dollars ($50.00)
to the City. No reduction shall be made for any part of the year having elapsed
at the time the license is applied for.
   If the City finds any plumbing to be contrary to the provisions of this
Plumbing Code relative to sanitation and plumbing, and the person responsible
for the violation of the law refuses to rectify the conditions complained of,
the City is authorized to refuse permission for further work on same, or the
use thereof, until the proper plumbing installation work is done by any
maintenance department and until a permit to do the work has been obtained as
required in this Plumbing Code.
   This Plumbing Code shall not apply to an individual person installing
plumbing, in accordance with the provisions prescribed in this Plumbing Code
for his/her own use in a single-family dwelling used exclusively for living
purposes and on premises owned and occupied by him/her for not less than six
months. Such person shall be granted a permit for the plumbing work by the City
upon the making of an affidavit that all the work shall be constructed and
installed by him/her without the help or hire of others, and the permit shall
be conditioned upon the approval of the work, at its completion, by the City.
However, nothing herein shall be construed as a waiver of the provisions
prescribed in this Plumbing Code relative to sanitation and plumbing.
(Ord. 87AC. Passed 9-1-58; Ord. 1733AC. Passed 12-5-83.)
1127.21  RECIPROCITY.
   Upon determination that the purposes of this Plumbing Code and the public
interest will not be hindered, the Housing Renewal Commission shall have the
power to waive the respective licensing requirements as to technical
qualifications and grant the license, upon the payment of the appropriate fee
and the posting of the appropriate bonds, in cases of applicants who are
licensed contractors in respective fields in other municipalities which require
licenses for contractors in the same field in which the particular license in
question is being applied for, and which allow contractors licensed by the City
to do work in such other municipalities by virtue of the license granted by the
City.
(1957 Code §1127.21; Ord. 94-67AC.  Passed 9-19-94.)
1127.22  FEES FOR RENEWAL OF PREVIOUSLY EXISTING LICENSES.
   Master plumbers and journeymen plumbers who hold duly authorized licenses
issued by the City, prior to the effective date of Ordinance 531, passed June
18, 1956, shall not be required to pay the initial fee of twenty-five dollars
($25.00) upon expiration of the licenses, but shall pay the renewal fee as
stipulated in Sections
1127.08 and
1127.09.
   Plumbers' licenses which may have been revoked prior to June 18, 1956, and
are reinstated after June 18, 1956, shall be renewed at a fee not to exceed
fifty percent of the initial fee required, nor less than the otherwise required
renewal fee. Renewal fees to be charged for revoked licenses shall be at the
discretion of the Housing Renewal Commission.  Licenses revoked after the
effective date of Ordinance 531, passed June 18, 1956, shall, upon
reinstatement, be assessed a penalty of fifty percent over and above the
required renewal fee.
(1957 Code §1127.22; Ord. 94-67AC.  Passed 9-19-94.)
1127.23  PERMITS REQUIRED FOR DRAINAGE, PLUMBING, WATER SUPPLY SYSTEMS AND WORK
BY PROPERTY OWNERS; EXCEPTION.
   (a)   No drainage system, plumbing system, water supply system or part
thereof shall be installed, altered, removed, replaced or repaired without a
permit from the City Manager, except for minor repairs, as defined in Section
1127.24 and which shall not require a permit, and except for all plumbing
maintenance work done by the employees of any person, firm or corporation that
has a full-time plumbing maintenance force.
   (b)   Any persons owning their own property are required to take out a
permit to install, alter or replace their own work on their own premises. The
work must be inspected and tested in accordance with the provisions of this
Plumbing Code.
(Ord. 114AC. Passed 5-4-59.)
1127.24  MINOR REPAIRS DEFINED.
   "Minor repairs" means the repairing of any existing fixture, the replacement
of faucets or valves, or parts thereof, with like materials or materials
serving the same purpose, the clearance of stoppages, stopping of leaks,
relieving of frozen pipes and other minor replacements or repairs classified as
minor repairs by the City Manager or his/her representative, provided no
changes other than those specifically described by this section are made in the
piping to the fixtures or in the drainage, vent or water supply system. 
(1957 Code §1127.24)
1127.25  SEWER CONNECTION PERMITS AND REQUIREMENTS.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: Former Section
1127.25  was repealed by Ordinance 1372AC,  passed May 15, 1978. See Chapter
915  of the Streets, Utilities and Public Services Code for current regulations
pertaining to sewer connection permit.)
1127.26  ANNUAL PERMIT FOR WORK BY PLUMBING MAINTENANCE FORCE.
   In lieu of a permit for each item of work performed by a person, firm or
corporation that has a full-time plumbing maintenance force, such person, firm
or  corporation shall take out an annual permit for such work for a fee in such
amount as provided by ordinance. However, the fee charged for the annual permit
for departments of the City and any political subdivision of the City,
including the Board of Education, shall be in such amount as provided by
ordinance.
(Ord. 114AC.  Passed 5-4-59.)
CHAPTER 1129
Plumbing Installation Rules
1129.01   Plumbing installation rules listed.
 
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Municipalities excepted from State inspection - see  Ohio R.C. 3703.01
Compliance with rules - see BLDG.
1121.02
Ohio Plumbing Code adopted - see BLDG.
1121.04
Plumbing regulations - see BLDG.
1131.01 et seq.
 
1129.01  PLUMBING INSTALLATION RULES LISTED.
   (1)   No part of the plumbing work or house drainage system shall be covered
or concealed in any way until after it has been inspected by the City Manager.
Notice must be given to the office of the City Manager when the work is
sufficiently advanced for inspection. When the plumbing work is finished, a
two-day notice must be given that the work is ready for final inspection.
   (2)   All plumbing and house drainage must be constructed according to the
rules and regulations of the State Plumbing Code, and the regulations as
follows:
   (3)   The arrangement of soil, waste and vent piping must be as direct as
possible.
   (4)   All materials must be of good quality and free from defects. The work
must be executed in a thorough and workmanlike manner.
   (5)   No trap or any manner of obstruction to the free flow of air through
the whole course of the main house sewer or soil lines will be allowed.
   (6)   No brick, sheet metal, earthenware or chimney flue shall be used as a
sewer ventilator or used to ventilate any trap, drain or soil or waste pipe.
   (7)   Before any soil pipe or soil pipe fittings are connected, they must be
thoroughly coated inside and outside with coal tar pitch, applied hot, or some
other equivalent substance. All cast-iron soil pipe must be sound, free from
sand holes and other defects, and of uniform weight and thickness, not lighter
than the commercial grade known as "extra heavy".
   (8)   All wrought-iron pipe must be sound and must be of what is known as
"Standard Grade Galvanized Pipe", with corresponding fittings: cast-iron,
malleable, black or galvanized, for vent lines, cast-iron recessed fittings,
black or galvanized, for waste lines.
   (9)   All soil, waste and vent lines must be securely supported and fastened
by hooks, hangers or pipe rests not more than ten feet apart.
   (10)   When lead pipe is used to connect fixtures with vertical soil and
waste pipes, it shall not be lighter than what is known as "Light".
   (11)   There shall be no traps on vertical pipes or vertical waste lines.
   (12)   All soil, waste and vent piping shall be tested by the plumber in
charge, and at his/her expense, in the presence of the City Manager. The
roughing test shall be made with either the peppermint, smoke, water or air
test, or by filling the system with water to the highest part of the stack,
according to the direction of the City Manager. Pipe, joints, fittings or
fixtures thus shown to be defective or wrongly placed must be corrected within
five days and retested. None of the piping shall be covered or concealed from
sight until it has been shown to stand the required test, and is satisfactory
to the City Manager. After the plumbing is completed and the fixtures set in
place and connected ready for use, a final test must be made by smoke,
peppermint or air to a pressure of two ounces or equal to one inch water
column.
   (13)   After the plumbing work has been tested as directed, no alterations
shall be permitted, except upon written application of the owner or plumber in
charge of the work. If any alterations or additions are made, the plumbing
system shall be retested by the final test requirements.
   (14)   Every water closet, urinal, sink, basin, wash tray, bathtub or set of
laundry trays must be separately and effectively trapped, except where a sink
and laundry tray or double compartment sink join each other, in which case the
waste pipe is not required to be separately trapped.
   (15)   No bell trap or any other trap depending for its seal on any easy
removable part will be allowed. For other trap and cleanout connections refer
to Section BB-51-20 et seq. of the Ohio State Plumbing Code.
   (16)   Downspout wastes shall not be connected to house sewers. Metallic
conductors, roof leaders or downspout wastes, surface and ground water drains
shall be connected with a sewer wherever possible, but shall not be connected
to a house sewer which discharges into a sanitary sewer intended for the
carriage of sewage only. If no storm sewer is available they may discharge
through the street curb.
(1957 Code §1129.01)
   (17)   It is an authorized use in the installation of drain, waste, vent and
pipe fittings to use plastic materials for such installations as follows:
polyvinyl chloride (PVC) U.S.D.C. CS 272-65 or an accepted equal.
(Ord. 533 AC.  Passed 9-6-67.)
CHAPTER 1131
Plumbing Regulations; Penalty
1131.01   Underground piping.
1131.02   Public sewers.
1131.03   Powers of City Manager.
1131.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Compliance - see BLDG.
1121.02
Ohio Plumbing Code adopted - see BLDG.
1121.04
Installation rules - see BLDG Ch.
1129
 
1131.01  UNDERGROUND PIPING.
   (a)   Excavation for building sewers or drainage piping shall be open trench
and kept open until the piping has been inspected and approved by the City
Manager.
   (b)   The trench shall be dug so as to meet the public sewer at the "Y"
connection shown on the map in the City Manager's office, but the City will not
be responsible for any inaccuracy in the location of the "Y". If the "Y" is not
on the location as shown, the City shall make a new tap or insert a new "Y" in
the trunk line and charge the cost back to the contracting plumber or the
property owner.
   (c)   The earth from the trench shall be placed so as not to obstruct the
gutter so as to cause the least inconvenience to the public.
   (d)   Proper barrier and danger signals must be maintained on the bank of
the trench to guard the public against accident during the progress of the
work.
   (e)   All underground piping shall be installed so as to be firmly supported
in its entire length, preferably on undisturbed bottom. Where backfill under
piping is unavoidable, it shall be thoroughly tamped and compacted or placed on
a sand bed.
   (f)   All underground piping shall be laid on an even grade, not less than
one-sixteenth inch per foot in length, unless provisions are made for regular
and efficient flushing. Curved pipe shall be used for every deflection from a
straight line of more than six inches in two feet. After the trench work is
completed, the surplus dirt must be removed from the street.
   (g)   For joints and connections see Sections 4101:2-51-12 et seq. Ohio
State Plumbing Code.
   (h)   Water service pipes or any underground water pipe shall not be run or
laid in the same trench as the building sewer or drainage piping, except that
the building sewer is built of extra heavy cast-iron pipe, properly calked with
lead and oakum, transite or fiber pipe, when made watertight.
   (i)   No gas piping shall be laid in the same trench with other piping at
any time.
   (j)   After the piping in the trench has been inspected and approved, the
trench shall be filled with bank sand or core sand to a depth not less than the
elevation of the street pavement in street work, and not less than four inches
above the house sewer from the curb line to the building which the sewer
serves.
(1957 Code §1131.01)
1131.02  PUBLIC SEWERS.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: Former Section
1131.02 was repealed by Ordinance 1372, passed May 15, 1978. See Chapter
915 of the Streets, Utilities and Public Services Code for current sewer
regulations.)
1131.03  POWERS OF CITY MANAGER.
   The City Manager shall perform all the duties as prescribed by this Plumbing
Code and such other duties connected therewith as the Council may specifically
direct.
(1957 Code §1131.03)
1131.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of the Plumbing Code being Title Five of this
Part Eleven - Building Code, or any regulation adopted thereunder, shall be
fined not more than five hundred dollars ($500.00) for each offense.
   EDITOR'S NOTE: Ordinance 1331 as passed November 7, 1977, authorizes the
Code Administrator to contract for electric improvement inspection services
until such time as the City has on its full-time staff a qualified and licensed
electric inspector.

1141.01  NATIONAL ELECTRICAL CODE ADOPTED:
   Under the provisions of Ohio R.C. 731.231 there is hereby adopted by the
City of Oberlin, and incorporated as if fully set out herein, for the purpose
of prescribing basic minimum provisions considered necessary for the safety of
persons and of buildings and their contents from hazards arising from the use
of electricity for light, heat, power, radio, signaling and for other purposes,
that certain code known as the National Electrical Code recommended by the
National Fire Protection Association and adopted by the Ohio Board of Building
Standards pursuant to Ohio R.C. 3781.10, being particularly the 2017 Edition
thereof. All electrical equipment and the installation thereof shall conform to
the provisions of the National Electrical Code except as otherwise provided in
this Title Seven.
(Ord. 18-46 AC CMS.  Passed 6-18-18.)
1141.02  FILE AND SALE COPIES.
   A complete copy of the Ohio Electrical Code as adopted herein is on file
with the Council Clerk and Chief Building Official for inspection by the public
and also on file in the Lorain County Law Library. The Council Clerk has copies
available for distribution to the public at cost.
(Ord. 18-46 AC CMS.  Passed 6-18-18.)

1143.01  LICENSE REQUIRED; EXCEPTIONS.
   No person shall engage in the business of installing, maintaining, altering
or repairing for others within the City any electric wiring, devices,
appliances or equipment unless the person shall have received an electrical
contractor's license and a certificate therefor, nor shall any person, except a
person employed by and working under the direction of a holder of an electrical
contractor's license or an electrician's license, in any manner undertake to
execute any work of installing, maintaining, altering or repairing any electric
wiring, devices or equipment unless the person shall have received either an
electrical contractor's license and a certificate therefor, or an electrician's
license and a certificate therefor, except that no license shall be required in
order to execute the following work:
   (a)   For any work involved in the manufacture, test or repair of electric
materials, devices, appliances or apparatus, but not including any permanent
wiring other than that required for testing purposes.
   (b)   For the assembly, erection and connection of electric apparatus and
equipment by the manufacturer of the apparatus and equipment, but not including
any electrical wiring other than that involved in making electric connections
on the apparatus or equipment itself, or between two or more parts of the
apparatus or equipment.
   (c)   For minor repair work, for the replacement of lamps or for the
connection of portable devices to suitable receptacles which have been
permanently installed.
   (d)   For the installation of wiring, devices, appliances and equipment for
the operation of signals or the transmission of information, where the wiring
devices, appliances or equipment operate at a voltage of not exceeding fifty
between conductors and do not include generating or transforming equipment
capable of supplying more than fifty watts of energy.
   (e)   For authorized persons of the utility company supplying power to
install service conductors from pole to service head, to maintain service and
distribution lines and to maintain their power producing equipment.
      (1957 Code §1143.01)
1143.02  ELECTRICIAN'S LICENSE.
   A license and certificate shall be issued by the City and shall be
designated as an electrician's license.
   (a)   Permitted Work; Hiring Assistants. This class of license shall entitle
the holder thereof to undertake the work of installation, servicing,
maintaining or repairing electrical devices, appliances, wiring and equipment
in the City, on premises wherein power supply connections of the utility
company exist. Nothing in this section shall prohibit the employment of
unlicensed helpers to assist licensed electricians.
   (b)   Application. Applications for licenses shall be made in writing to the
City and state the class of license applied for, the name, address and place of
business of the applicant and the name of the representative of the applicant
who will act as the supervisor of the work to be done under the license. All
license applications shall be certified by the City to the Housing Renewal
Commission.
   (c)   Holder of License. Each applicant for a license issued in accordance
with the provisions of this section shall be known as the holder of the
license.
      (Ord. 3 AC. Passed 5-6-57; Ord. 94-67AC.  Passed 9-19-94.)
1143.03  LICENSE FEES; RECIPROCITY.
   Before a license is granted to any applicant, and before any expiring
license is renewed, the applicant shall pay the City a fee in an amount as
provided by ordinance. Upon determination that the purposes of this Electrical
Code and the public interest will not be hindered, the Housing Renewal
Commission shall have the power to waive the respective licensing requirements
as to technical qualifications and grant the license upon payment of the
appropriate fee and the posting of the appropriate bonds in cases of applicants
who are licensed contractors in respective fields in other municipalities which
require licenses for contractors in the same field for which the particular
license in question is being applied for, and which allow electricians licensed
by the City to do work in such other municipalities by virtue of the license
granted by the City.
(Ord. 33 AC. Passed 12-16-57; Ord. 94-67AC.  Passed 9-19-94.)
1143.04  BOND AND INSURANCE.
   Licensed electricians may be required to furnish a one thousand dollar
($1,000) bond to the City to hold the public property free of damage. Each
licensed electrician shall carry insurance in the amount of twenty-five
thousand dollars ($25,000) and fifty thousand dollars ($50,000) minimum public
liability and property damage.
(Ord. 1048 AC. Passed 6-17-74.)
1143.05  RENEWAL OF LICENSES AND CERTIFICATES.
   Each license shall expire on December 31 following the date of its issue and
shall be renewed by the City upon application of the holder of the license and
certificate. Payment of the required fees may be made any time before or on
January 1 of each year. If there is a lapse of over sixty days from the
expiration of a license renewal, the renewal fee shall be the same as on an
original application. All persons required to procure licenses on October 1,
1956, under the provisions of Ordinance 544, passed October 1, 1956, shall do
so within sixty days. Upon presentation of a written affidavit by an applicant
stating that the applicant has engaged in the installation, maintenance,
alteration and repair of electric wiring, devices, appliances and equipment as
a business, or has been employed in the City for a period of not less than
three years prior to October 1, 1956, the applicant shall not be required to
pass an examination but shall pay the initial fee. The affidavit shall be
subject to review and approval by the Housing Renewal Commission before
issuance of a license by the City. The applicant, upon approval by the Housing
Renewal Commission, shall pay the required fee as stipulated in Section
1143.03.
(1957 Code §1143.05; Ord. 94-67AC.  Passed 9-19-94.)
1143.06  DISPLAY OF CERTIFICATES.
   Every holder of a contractor's license, shall keep his/her certificate of
license displayed in a conspicuous place in his/her principal place of business
or on the job.
   Every holder of an electrician's license shall keep his/her certificate of
license immediately available.
(1957 Code §1143.06)
1143.07  LICENSE TRANSFERABILITY AND REVOCATION.
   No license and certificate issued in accordance with the provision of this
chapter shall be assignable or transferable. Any license may, after hearing, be
suspended or revoked by the Housing Renewal Commission if the person holding
the license willfully, or by reason of incompetence, repeatedly violates any
statutes of the State or any ordinance or rule or regulation of the City
relating to the installation, maintenance, alteration or repair of electric
wiring, devices, appliances and equipment.
(1957 Code §1143.07; Ord. 94-67AC.  Passed 9-19-94.)
1143.08  SUPERVISION OF ELECTRICAL MAINTENANCE FORCE.
   All electrical maintenance work done by any person, firm or corporation with
a full-time electrical maintenance force shall be done by or under the direct
supervision of an individual holding a license as designated in Section
1143.02.
(Ord. 55AC.  Passed 4-7-58.)
CHAPTER 1145
Materials, Inspections and Tests
